result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa R Buck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
If confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school.
COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with co-defendants  Anthony Buck  AND/OR  Albert Martinez.

Any prescriptions must be obtained through ONE physician only.
Any prescriptions for controlled substances - a copy must be provided to the probation agent.
Successfully complete a Parenting class.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: with release for medical and obstetrician appointments. Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 15, 2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa R Buck

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  36  months  with 41  days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18  months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  18  months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

Court finds defendant   IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 3 months in the House of Correction with release for medical and obstetrician appointments.  Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 15, 2016.
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Any prescriptions must be obtained through ONE physician only
-  Any prescriptions for controlled substances - a copy must be provided to the probation agent
-  Successfully complete a Parenting class
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with co-defendants  Anthony Buck  AND/OR  Albert Martinez
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Any prescriptions must be obtained through ONE physician only
-  Any prescriptions for controlled substances - a copy must be provided to the probation agent
-  Successfully complete a Parenting class
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with co-defendants  Anthony Buck  AND/OR  Albert Martinez
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
If confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. J. Toran appears by telephone conference.
Defense counsel requests adjournment of today's scheduled sentencing hearing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court reinstates monitoring.  Court ordered defendant to report to Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charge as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Jury trial is vacated.

State files Amended Information with the court.

Count 1:  Fleeing Or Eluding An Officer, a Class I felony, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 346.04(3), 939.50(3)(i)

Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Discharge Summary dated December 23, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.  Court will address with the parties on the next court date.
Clerk:  jms

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Pretrial Services to contact the court if defendant fails to report to their office on December 16.
Clerk:  jms
Justice Point Violation Reports (2) received and filed.  Justice Point states the Court does not need to take action at this time.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.   Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Parties request this matter be scheduled for Jury Trial and Final Pretrial.
Justice Point Report received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Melissa R Buck not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney requests a short adjournement for another status conference.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report received and filed.  Per letter, no action needed by Court
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  No action taken at this time.  Court will address violation on the next court date.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Melissa R Buck not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney recently appointed.  Discovery and offer needed.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Attorney Toran in trial in another court.  Matter reset for Status.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Matter set for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel is requesting an adjournment.  Defendant is in the process of obtaining private counsel.  State is prepared to commence the Preliminary Hearing.  Court informs Attorney Taylor she will remain as appointed counsel at this time.
Case is temporarily passed.

Case is recalled.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  (Defense Counsel is not available July 6, 2015 for scheduling date that was set for co-defendant previously.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/30/15.

15RM031198  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-26-2015
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Melissa R Buck in custody.  Joanne Hardtke for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is requesting an adjournment for time to obtain private counsel.  State has no objection to an adjournment at this time. Attorney Taylor will remain as counsel if the defendant does not have counsel on the next scheduled court date.    Court ordered case adjourned for CASUE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with George N. or Co-Defendants Anthony Buck or Albert Martinez

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Melissa R Buck in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Melissa R Buck in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
